title: History in address bar pull down menu
content: I used to have 10 history addresses in the pull down menu from the address bar, now I only have 5. Is there a way to reset it to 10 in the listing?
creator: cindiras

title: Momentum Scrolling Not Working
content:
Hello,

I am currently using Firefox as my main browser on my Windows 10 laptop. I have had no issues with it except for a rather annoying bug I have had with scrolling. Whenever I open Firefox for the first time after powering on my laptop, scrolling with my touchpad will sometimes become choppy, no longer continuing to move after I lift my fingers like it normally does. I am pretty certain it is only Firefox that is doing this, as when I open the Windows start menu, inertial scrolling still works. Is this a bug that other users have had before?
creator: hrusso014

title: Firefox Monitor Question
content:
I recently received an alert about a couple of unresolved breaches listed at the Firefox Monitor site. So I signed in to take a look. One of the breaches was a site for which I never actually had an account. Evite But for which it is possible I may have received communications from, like an evite to something at a different email address. I am curious as to how there could have been a breach of my email password for which I received the alert ... since I never had an account for Evite, and never directly interacted with evite at the "breached" email address

sort of a mystery

title: All Kinds of stuff honestly
content: I initially had trouble because a website for school, called Wiley,com, or Wiley Plus, was having trouble. Specifically, i could most things and when I would attempt to open a homework assignment, Id get an error. According to my professor, it was a Firefox issue, and he was right, when I went to Google, which I hate, it worked just fine. Then slowly, there were more problems opening up my school website or my bitwarden extension would have issues. So today, I finally uninstalled, and reinstalled. Which, unfortunately, I have had to do with Firefox twice before. Frustrating, but I hate Google enough that I chalked it up. Then, after this most current reinstall, it completely screwed things up with my bitwarden extension and bitwarden themselves, because for some reason, Firefox is sending weird info that freaks websites out. Outside of the extensions, it often cant open sites, or sites tell me something is happening. I have Norton and have scanned my device repeatedly, and gone so far as to contact them and my computer is clean. What...is going on. I STILL haven't sorted out the Bitwarden fiasco and have had to contact their support, but honestly, the problem CAME from the firefox browser. I dont know how to fix this
creator: jarden714

title: Web Pages Keep Re-opening
content: I keep closing webpages when I am done and when I restart my computer ALL the pages reopen in my browser. I closed 300 tabs, went to Firefox view and cleared the "recently closed tabs" from there. I restarted my computer and 400 were opened again. These tabs keep reappearing again. How can I close these and not have them open again?
